content: Songwriters and recording artists have legal rights to be paid for reproductions and performances of their music. However, they do not have complete control over their music, as cover versions can be made under certain conditions. For example, Taylor Swift withdrew her music from Spotify, but a cover version by Ryan Adams was still available on the platform. Copyright law allows for this as long as royalties are paid. As a singer who owns the rights to her sound recordings, Taylor Swift can withdraw her music from Spotify, but as a songwriter, she cannot control how the music service uses other versions of her songs.
